intro: Arnebia bhattacharyyae, commonly known as the Bhattacharyya's bloodroot, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red-orange flowers and basal leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its root system is notable for containing compounds with potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
